data.name: Add

data.comment: Alert title when something goes wrong.

data.name: Back
data.comment: Navigate back to the previous screen.

data.name: Bitwarden
data.comment: App name. Shouldn't ever change.

data.name: Cancel
data.comment: Cancel an operation.

data.name: Copy
data.comment: Copy some value to your clipboard.

data.comment: The button text that allows a user to copy the login's password to their clipboard.

data.name: CopyUsername
data.comment: The button text that allows a user to copy the login's username to their clipboard.

data.value: Use the Bitwarden accessibility service to auto-fill your logins across apps and the web.

data.value: Set Bitwarden as your passkey provider in device settings.

data.name: BitwardenAppExtensionAlert2
data.value: The easiest way to add new logins to your vault is from the Bitwarden app extension. Learn more about using the Bitwarden app extension by navigating to the "Settings" screen.

data.name: BitwardenAppExtensionDescription
data.value: Use Bitwarden in Safari and other apps to auto-fill your logins.

data.value: Use the Bitwarden accessibility service to auto-fill your logins.

data.value: You can change your email address on the bitwarden.com web vault. Do you want to visit the website now?

data.name: EnterEmailForHint
data.value: Enter your account email address to receive your master password hint.

data.value: Mynnwch fynediad i'ch cyfrineiriau ar unwaith!

data.value: Quickly bulk import your items from other password management apps.

data.name: MoveToOrgDesc
data.value: Choose an organization that you wish to move this item to. Moving to an organization transfers ownership of the item to that organization. You will no longer be the direct owner of this item once it has been moved.

data.name: Clear
data.comment: To clear something out. example: To clear browser history.

data.name: Generator
data.comment: Short for "Password Generator"

data.name: FingerprintPhrase
data.comment: A 'fingerprint phrase' is a unique word phrase (similar to a passphrase) that a user can use to authenticate their public key with another user, for the purposes of sharing.

data.comment: A 'fingerprint phrase' is a unique word phrase (similar to a passphrase) that a user can use to authenticate their public key with another user, for the purposes of sharing.

data.name: LearnOrgConfirmation

data.name: ExportVaultMasterPasswordDescription
data.value: Rhowch eich prif gyfrinair i allforio data eich cell.

data.name: SendVerificationCodeToEmail
data.value: Send a verification code to your email

data.name: ExportVaultWarning
data.value: This export contains your vault data in an unencrypted format. You should not store or send the exported file over unsecure channels (such as email). Delete it immediately after you are done using it.

data.name: EncExportKeyWarning
data.value: This export encrypts your data using your account's encryption key. If you ever rotate your account's encryption key you should export again since you will not be able to decrypt this export file.

data.name: EncExportAccountWarning
data.value: Account encryption keys are unique to each Bitwarden user account, so you can't import an encrypted export into a different account.

data.name: ExportVaultConfirmationTitle
data.comment: Title for the alert to confirm vault exports.

data.name: ExportVaultFailure
data.value: There was a problem exporting your vault. If the problem persists, you'll need to export from the web vault.

data.comment: Clone an entity (verb).

data.value: Contain one or more lowercase characters

data.name: AccessibilityDrawOverPermissionAlert
data.value: Bitwarden needs attention - Turn on "Draw-Over" in "Auto-fill Services" from Bitwarden Settings

data.name: InlineAutofillDescription
data.value: Use inline autofill if your selected IME (keyboard) supports it. If your configuration is not supported (or this option is turned off), the default Autofill overlay will be used.

data.name: AccessibilityDescription
data.value: Use the Bitwarden Accessibility Service to auto-fill your logins across apps and the web. When set up, we'll display a popup when login fields are selected.

data.name: AccessibilityDescription2
data.value: Use the Bitwarden Accessibility Service to auto-fill your logins across apps and the web. (Requires Draw-Over to be turned on as well)

data.name: AccessibilityDescription3
data.value: Use the Bitwarden Accessibility Service to use the Autofill Quick-Action Tile, and/or show a popup using Draw-Over (if turned on).

data.name: AccessibilityDescription4
data.value: Required to use the Autofill Quick-Action Tile, or to augment the Autofill Service by using Draw-Over (if turned on).

data.name: DrawOverDescription
data.value: Allows the Bitwarden Accessibility Service to display a popup when login fields are selected.

data.name: DrawOverDescription2
data.value: If turned on, the Bitwarden Accessibility Service will display a popup when login fields are selected to assist with auto-filling your logins.

data.name: DrawOverDescription3
data.value: If turned on, accessibility will show a popup to augment the Autofill Service for older apps that don't support the Android Autofill Framework.

data.name: PersonalOwnershipSubmitError
data.value: Due to an enterprise policy, you are restricted from saving items to your individual vault. Change the ownership option to an organization and choose from available collections.

data.name: PersonalOwnershipPolicyInEffect
data.value: An organization policy is affecting your ownership options.

data.name: PasswordConfirmationDesc
data.value: This action is protected, to continue please re-enter your master password to verify your identity.

data.name: UpdateMasterPasswordWarning
data.value: Your master password was recently changed by an administrator in your organization. In order to access the vault, you must update your master password now. Proceeding will log you out of your current session, requiring you to log back in. Active sessions on other devices may continue to remain active for up to one hour.

data.name: RemoveMasterPasswordWarning
data.value: {0} is using SSO with customer-managed encryption. Continuing will remove your master password from your account and require SSO to login.

data.name: RemoveMasterPasswordWarning2
data.value: If you do not want to remove your master password, you may leave this organization.

data.name: Fido2Instruction
data.value: To continue, have your FIDO2 WebAuthn compatible security key ready, then follow the instructions after clicking 'Authenticate WebAuthn' on the next screen.

data.name: Fido2Desc
data.value: Authentication using FIDO2 WebAuthn, you can authenticate using an external security key.

data.name: Fido2CheckBrowser
data.value: Please make sure your default browser supports WebAuthn and try again.

data.name: ResetPasswordAutoEnrollInviteWarning
data.value: This organization has an enterprise policy that will automatically enroll you in password reset. Enrollment will allow organization administrators to change your master password.

data.name: VaultTimeoutPolicyInEffect
data.value: Your organization policies have set your maximum allowed vault timeout to {0} hour(s) and {1} minute(s).

data.name: VaultTimeoutPolicyWithActionInEffect

data.name: VaultTimeoutToLarge
data.value: Your vault timeout exceeds the restrictions set by your organization.

data.name: DisablePersonalVaultExportPolicyInEffect
data.value: One or more organization policies prevents your from exporting your individual vault.

data.value: Setting your lock options to “Never” keeps your vault available to anyone with access to your device. If you use this option, you should ensure that you keep your device properly protected.

data.name: AccessibilityDisclosureText
data.value: Bitwarden uses the Accessibility Service to search for login fields in apps and websites, then establish the appropriate field IDs for entering a username & password when a match for the app or site is found. We do not store any of the information presented to us by the service, nor do we make any attempt to control any on-screen elements beyond text entry of credentials.

data.name: UpdateWeakMasterPasswordWarning
data.value: Your master password does not meet one or more of your organization policies. In order to access the vault, you must update your master password now. Proceeding will log you out of your current session, requiring you to log back in. Active sessions on other devices may continue to remain active for up to one hour.

data.value: Turn off using a public device

data.value: You cannot edit passkey application because it would invalidate the passkey

data.name: ThePasskeyWillNotBeCopiedToTheClonedItemDoYouWantToContinueCloningThisItem
data.value: The passkey will not be copied to the cloned item. Do you want to continue cloning this item?

data.name: UnlockingMayFailDueToInsufficientMemoryDecreaseYourKDFMemorySettingsToResolve
data.value: Unlocking may fail due to insufficient memory. Decrease your KDF memory settings or set up biometric unlock to resolve.

data.value: Your request has been sent to your admin.

data.name: YouWillBeNotifiedOnceApproved

data.name: VaultTimeoutActionChangedToLogOut
data.value: Vault timeout action changed to log out

data.value: Auto-fill will not be offered for these URIs.

data.value: Fformat annilys. Defnyddiwch https://, http://, neu androidapp://

data.name: CannotEditMultipleURIsAtOnce
data.value: Methu golygu mwy nag un URI ar unwaith

data.name: LogInWithDeviceMustBeSetUpInTheSettingsOfTheBitwardenAppNeedAnotherOption
data.value: Log in with device must be set up in the settings of the Bitwarden app. Need another option?

data.name: AccountFingerprintPhrase
data.comment: A 'fingerprint phrase' is a unique word phrase (similar to a passphrase) that a user can use to authenticate their public key with another user, for the purposes of sharing.

data.name: PasskeyManagementExplanationLong
data.value: Use Bitwarden to save new passkeys and log in with passkeys stored in your vault.

data.name: AutofillServicesExplanationLong
data.value: The Android Autofill Framework is used to assist in filling login information into other apps on your device.

data.name: UseInlineAutofillExplanationLong
data.value: Use inline autofill if your selected keyboard supports it. Otherwise, use the default overlay.

data.name: ContinueToX
data.comment: The parameter is an URL, like bitwarden.com.

data.name: TwoStepLoginDescriptionLong
data.value: Gallwch wneud eich cyfrif yn fwy diogel drwy alluogi mewngofnodi dau gam yn ap gwe Bitwarden.

data.name: ChangeMasterPasswordDescriptionLong
data.value: You can change your master password on the Bitwarden web app.

data.name: YouCanImportDataToYourVaultOnX
data.value: You can import data to your vault on {0}.
data.comment: The parameter is an URL, like vault.bitwarden.com.

data.name: LearnMoreAboutHowToUseBitwardenOnTheHelpCenter
data.value: Learn more about how to use Bitwarden on the Help center.

data.name: ContactSupportDescriptionLong
data.value: Can’t find what you are looking for? Reach out to Bitwarden support on bitwarden.com.

data.name: PrivacyPolicyDescriptionLong
data.value: Check out our privacy policy on bitwarden.com.

data.name: ExploreMoreFeaturesOfYourBitwardenAccountOnTheWebApp
data.value: Explore more features of your Bitwarden account on the web app.

data.name: LearnAboutOrganizationsDescriptionLong
data.value: Bitwarden allows you to share your vault items with others by using an organization. Learn more on the bitwarden.com website.

data.name: RateAppDescriptionLong
data.value: Help others find out if Bitwarden is right for them. Visit the app store and leave a rating now.

data.name: DefaultDarkThemeDescriptionLong
data.value: Choose the dark theme to use when your device’s dark mode is in use

data.name: CreatedXY
data.comment: To state the date/time in which the cipher was created: Created 03/21/2023, 09:25 AM. First parameter is the date and the second parameter is the time.

data.name: SetUpAutoFillDescriptionLong
data.value: To set up password auto-fill and passkey management, set Bitwarden as your preferred provider in the iOS Settings.

data.name: FirstDotGoToYourDeviceSettingsPasswordsPasswordOptions
data.value: 1. Go to your device's Settings > Passwords > Password Options

data.name: ThirdDotSelectBitwardenToUseForPasswordsAndPasskeys
data.value: 3. Select "Bitwarden" to use for passwords and passkeys
